appellant, an iranian, sought a protection visa on the basis that he had converted to christianity after leaving iran
refugee review tribunal twice affirmed decision to refuse the appellant a protection visa

relying on information contained in a country profile, the tribunal distinguished between christians in iran who quietly go about their devotions and those who actively or conspicuously proselytise, and considered that only the latter group would encounter a real chance of persecution
